tool.name: filter tree
tool.description: This script prunes a tree based on a set of tip names
tool.command:
filter_tree.py -i $input_tree_filepath -o $output_tree_filepath #if $negate: -n #end if
#if str($tips_fp) != 'None': -t $tips_fp #end if
#if str($fasta_fp) != 'None': -f $fasta_fp #end if

param.label: -n/--negate: if negate is True will remove input tips/seqs, if negate is False, will retain input tips/seqs [default: False]
param.name: negate

param.label: -t/--tips_fp: A list of tips (one tip per line) or sequence identifiers (tab-delimited lines with a seq identifier in the first field) which should be retained [default: None]
param.name: tips_fp

param.label: -f/--fasta_fp: A fasta file where the seq ids should be retained [default: None]
param.name: fasta_fp

tool.help: This script takes a tree and a list of OTU IDs (in one of several supported formats) and outputs a subtree retaining only the tips on the tree which are found in the inputted list of OTUs (or not found, if the --negate option is provided). Output is a pruned tree in newick format.
